intro: Dicliptera bupleuroides var. roxburghiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf false bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
